programmes.show_description: The 14 Brits who set off to climb one of New Zealand's highest peaks are down to 10. Having made it to the second base camp, they face a vote-off presided over by host Ben Shephard. As an exhausting snow hike sees the nine remaining climbers tested physically and mentally, call centre worker Sean struggles to keep up, a challenging rope crossing sees influencer Tara forced to find unconventional methods to stay on track, and the Mountain's Keeper sets a dramatic test

Jimmy Doherty and Shivi Ramoutar are joined in the kitchen by TV presenter and author Julia Bradbury for cooking, chat and craft. Shivi rustles up homemade breakfast muffins, there is a coffee-brewing masterclass with Alice Wainwright, and Jimmy shows how anyone can make a miniature garden wildlife pond. Also on the programme, Shivi visits a wetland area in London for a bird-watching experience and upcycling guru Max McMurdo converts an old door into a garden bench
Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

Rob Brydon hosts a game show in which 81 contestants compete in a high-tension battle of knowledge, nerve and strategy. Standing on a vast floor made up of 81 squares, each of which represents a unique category, players go head-to-head in quick-fire duels
Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features
Early morning chat show presented by Lorraine Kelly, with celebrity interviews, entertainment news, cooking tips, fashion features and musical guests.
Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more
Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective
The key headlines from the day so far

David Dickinson hosts from Bradford in West Yorkshire, where the owner of a gold coin collection hopes he can turn his expensive investment into a profit. Plus, sellers turn down tempting cash offers for a gold medal and old bank notes to take their chances at auction, and local dealer Tim Hogarth offers extra cash to a seller if he can name famous Bradfordians

Ranvir Singh hosts the quiz where Andy and Lorraine, Maisie and Andrew, and Carl and Ashley take on Riddlemaster Henry Lewis in an attempt to solve a series of riddles - packed full of confusing conundrums and quick-fire general knowledge questions, only one team can make it through to the high-stakes final of Henry's Riddle Run and earn the chance to win an exciting cash prize as they take on a series of riddles against the clock

Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot
Elaine from the Wirral, Jack from Morecambe, Chloe from Wigan and Nick from Bristol hope they can beat a Chaser together and leave with thousands of pounds. Bradley Walsh asks the questions

programmes.show_name: STV News at Six and Weather
programmes.show_description: Including regional weather forecast
A round-up of the day's news headlines and talking points from the UK and around the world
Movie news, chat about favourite TV programmes, and music. Plus, catch-ups with some of the biggest names in worldwide entertainment
Marlon is furious, while Paddy is determined to help his dad and Kammy and Ross play Cupid
Sam checks his phone for evidence of Megan and Will's affair, Debbie vows to make amends to Carl, and Jodie stirs up trouble at The Kabin

Bradley Walsh hosts as Jane, Jonathan, Chigozie, Michael and Oliver take on the Sinnerman, the Beast, the Governess, the Menace, the Vixen and the Dark Destroyer in the hope of winning thousands of pounds
A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programmes.show_name: Devil in Disguise: John Wayne Gacy
programmes.show_description: A psychiatrist uncovers Gacy's dark history as Tovar and Kozenczak examine how systems failed to stop his murders, and a romance develops between Billy Kindred and Mary Jane. Drama, starring Michael Chernus and Gabriel Luna

Jonathan is joined by comedian and Celebrity Traitors winner Alan Carr, American actress Neve Campbell, comedian Rob Beckett and his author wife Lou, and actor Archie Madekwe, while there is music by Mumford & Sons

The group has now been reduced from 14 to 11 as brutal hikes and treacherous crossings prove too much for some. After they grapple with who should leave the mountain at the first vote-off, the Mountain's Keeper forces their hand yet again with a difficult decision that has everyone feeling vulnerable. Will the ensuing elimination see the group vote with their heads or their hearts?
Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

The duo host as competitive father-and-daughter duo David and Emma take on the challenge that gives contestants a chance to win a limitless jackpot by climbing an endless money ladder. Having already overcome significant personal hurdles and been put in a great place by their competitiveness, can David's risk-taking be balanced by level-headed Emma to help them scale the dizzying heights of the ladder, or will they crash out before they can cash out?

programmes.show_name: Deal or No Deal: Banker's Best Battles
programmes.show_description: Stephen Mulhern hosts as he revisits Brian and Kelly's fierce Deal or No Deal clashes with the terrible Banker. Do they have the strength to take him on and win as they open the iconic red boxes, or does the mysterious money man keep hold of the jackpot once again?

programmes.show_name: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programmes.show_description: Joining Alan at Manor Farm are TV presenter Penny Lancaster and triple Olympic gold-medal winning gymnast Max Whitlock. Garden designer Chris Hull welcomes in the Year of the Horse with a display of plants in honour of the Chinese New Year, and food writer Jonathan Phang combines his passion for delicious artisanal produce with creative flair and genial hospitality as he provides the perfect vessel for a midday snack

Prue is joined by actress Sophie Winkleman, making her a chicken pie using hot-water crust pastry, then prepares an oxtail stew and dumplings served with frozen mashed potato. Meanwhile, her husband John heads out to the garden to catch up with gardener Philippa, and Prue's food hero this time is a northern Chinese restaurant that is making waves in south Wales.
A round-up of the latest headlines
James cooks up a feast of delicious food for singer Freya Ridings and sports presenter Jill Douglas, while there are also recipes from chefs Sat Bains and Dipna and Gulu Anand

Ainsley Harriott heads to the capital Nassau, where he climbs the Queen's Staircase walkway and visits the colonial-era Fort Charlotte. He joins Simeon Hall Jr to explore the deep roots of Bahamian history before rounding things off with a hearty island veggie stew pot and a warm Johnny cake
Round-up of the latest headlines

England v Ireland (Kick-off 2.10pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from both teams' third match of the championship, held at Allianz Stadium Twickenham. Ireland claimed a hard-fought 27-22 win when the teams met at Aviva Stadium last year, but England ended up finishing one place above them in the table in second due to having one more bonus point, but one fewer than champions France. With analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Brian O'Driscoll and Rory Best, pitchside inserts by Topsy Ojo, and commentary from Nick Mulliins, David Flatman and Gordon D'Arcy
Round-up of the latest headlines

Bradley Walsh hosts as Catherine Tyldesley, Levi Roots, Chris McCausland and Rick Wakeman pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

Graham Norton hosts the game show as firefighter Kerrie, financial adviser Richard and account manager Ciaran compete to solve word puzzles to get the chance to spin the wheel and win big money prizes, with a potential jackpot of £50,000

Ant and Dec host the nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts compete for the chance to win a cash prize of £250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Musician KSI replaces Bruno Tonioli on the judging panel, joining Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden and Alesha Dixon for the first set of auditions at Blackpool's Winter Gardens

Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

Jonathan is joined by American actor Patrick Dempsey, comedian and Brits host Jack Whitehall, and Self Esteem, aka singer-songwriter Rebecca Lucy Taylor, who will be chatting and performing in the studio

programmes.show_name: It'll Be Alright on the Night
programmes.show_description: Compilation of TV clangers featuring Alexander Armstrong, Richard Ayoade, Rob Beckett, Ant and Dec, Alan Carr, Patrick Kielty, Coleen Nolan, the cast of Heartstopper and many more. Highlights include disaster striking on Britain's Got Talent when Alesha Dixon experiences an unexpected wardrobe malfunction. Tom Allen presents
Round-up of the latest headlines
